shows.title: GMO Update / Vampire & Supernatural Artifacts
shows.first_half: First Half: Author and consumer advocate Jeffrey Smith will discuss genetically modified foods (GMOs) in relation to health. He'll report how Congress is considering giving liability protection to Monsanto/Bayer and other pesticide companies, and reveal the shocking ways that he believes Monsanto defrauded the government, science, and consumers.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Author and museum curator Edmondo Crimi will talk about how art has been influenced by the battle between good and evil, and explore his museum of vampire art and paranormal activity, a venue that stimulates learning and understanding of the supernatural.

shows.title: Future of Technology / Open Lines
shows.first_half: Journalist Kevin Cirilli joins guest host Rich Berra (email) for a discussion on what it means for us to build a future that still feels human as we race to colonize Mars, deal with data becoming emotion, and handle the rise of AI that writes, learns, and dreams. Cirilli explores the intersection of space, technology, and consciousness, delving into the time when the story of our future shifts from being about machines to being about us. Followed by Open Lines in the latter half. Give Rich a call and discuss whatever is on your mind!
